title: Tattoos
content:
I'd like to get a tattoo one day. Probably the Scooter logo to my neck or something. Naturally this may be just another thing that I want but never actually get myself going to take one. Anyways, please answer the following questions:

1. Do you have any tattoos?
2. If not, are you going to get one?
3. Is there anything wrong with tattoos? Any reason why I should not take one?
4. Do you like them?3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
1. no
2. I'm not a sailor (yes narrow mindness alert)
3. Chances that you still like Scooter when you're a thirty are small, what are you goin to do then?
4. No not at all-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
1.) Not yet.
2.) No not really but if I HAD to get a tattoo I would get a dragon.
3.) Like Djaser said... you will probably regret it. Especially if it is for something that will probably not be popular in a few years. (I don't know what Scooter is. I am assuming it is a band or something?)
4.) Personally I am not a fan of permanently altering your body to look "Better." This is the same reason I am against people gauging their ears.

So... No.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/New-blegd-smeeg-banner-60.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
1. Yes

2. I plan to get more in the future. Something Keen related I think, but I'm not sure what yet.

3. There are three dangers that I can think of.

First, and most likely, is that you'll regret it later. So think long and hard. Make sure you get something that's close to your heart, and that will stay that way. And if you're feeling like you "have to" get one because something is just that important to you, then take a few months to cool off. If you're too excited then you're not thinking clearly, and it's essential that you be rational when contemplating a permanent change to your body. You wouldn't want to regret it later.

Second is that it could hurt you socially or in the workplace. Many employers won't allow visible tattoos, and some people might think less of you because of it. If either of these worry you, then make sure you get in a place they won't see it. Somewhere inside your clothes is good.

Third, and least likely, is that something would go wrong with the tattooing itself. Allergic reactions to the ink or possible. A tattoo is an *invasive medical procedure*, and as such it carries a risk of infection. More likely than not, it would go fine if you got it done by someone reputable, but it's something to take into account.

4. Yes. It's not necessarily about looking better, but about looking the way you want.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
That's a good point, you do run the risk of hurting yourself socially. Think of something you don't respect or like, and imagine meeting someone with the logo of that tattooed around their neck - you'd immediately think less of them because of it, so it could put you at a disadvantage if it's too visible.

Also, what happens if Scooter suddenly do something you find embarassing? What if they get bored with their style of music and join forces with Marilyn Manson (or a Christan rock group, whichever you find worse) and suddenly your tattoo represents something quite different? Or they could make it big as a children's entertainment group, and people would be wondering why you've got a tattoo that might as well say "Barbie" [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
Good points, although I was thinking of people who might dislike you because of your tattoo, no matter what it was. Just because they don't like tattoos.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
Wow, I would've never thought so many here are actually against them! What kind of tattoo you got lemur?

Anyways, I've read about all those things you people mentioned. And just to note, isn't tattoo removal possible anymore? At least it has been.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

This isn't any way to try to get myself looking better or such (a tattoo wouldn't do that) as Gal said. I've seriously thought getting one for about a year or more. I'd definitely get Scooter tattoo (or something Keen, or both [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ). Scooter is my favourite band and I'll always love their music. I think it's pretty much a band that people either love or hate. I don't care whether they're that popular or not, I wouldn't get the tattoo because of any popularity, I'd get it because I like them. Besides, I wouldn't get anything huge tattoo, just something small.

And yeah, perhaps placing it on the neck is a bit too visible. Too bad there are such 'dangers'. I think I could place it on the left forearm or higher.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Tattoos
content:
Mine is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summation]summation[/url]. Nerdy as all get-out.

Tattoo removal is technically possible, but it's not exactly easy. It's as painful (some say even more) as getting a tattoo in the first place, but it's way more expensive. It's also possible that it will leave a scar behind, since tattoos involve some scarring. It sounds worse to me than just keeping the thing. title: Re: Tattoos
content:
What once was meant to be a statement
a dripping dagger held in the fist
of a shuddering heartis now just a bruise
on a bony old shoulder, the spot
where vanity once punched him hard
and the ache lingered on. He looks like
someone you had to reckon with,
strong as a stallion, fast and ornery,
but on this chilly morning, as he walks
between the tables at a yard sale
with the sleeves of his tight black T-shirt
rolled up to show us who he was,
he is only another old man, picking up
broken tools and putting them back,
his heart gone soft and blue with stories.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Eheheh.
content:
How the hell have I missed this thread previously?

[hr]freeyorp Ugh, drinking to get drunk is just ... ugh. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img]
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Then why drink at all? It tastes like shit.

[hr]TMST Drinking to not get drunk is thought of as being like climbing up a diving board just to climb down again.
[hr]AMEN!

[hr]lemur Commander Keen never would have gotten off the ground without alchohol. Granted, he didn't use it for drinking....
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] I never thought about that before. Hmm...

I don't intend to get a tattoo (or piercings). In fact, I grew bored with colouring my hair after trying it a few times over the course of a couple of years. I figure no matter how much I make myself look different I'll still be me, so I might as well be comfortable with the fact.

Though I do consider the possibility sometimes--there are a few things which are such a big part of my life that I would like to make some kind of statement about them (ie. Keen).

The 'bored of it when you're thirty' argument I don't see holding up--30 is practically 21, and already my fandom of Keen has lasted 15 years. The fact that there are so many likeminded people out there indicates that won't dissipate any time soon.

Besides, I don't consider that I have that high a pain tolerance. Having a needle jabbing into my skin for half an hour isn't my idea of fun, even for the sake of self-expression.

I'm all for the Scooter tattoo. They are teh pwnage. However, I find a better way of getting the point across is to crank their music at full volume.

[hr]Lemur Commander Keen never would have gotten off the ground without alchohol.
[hr]

title: Re: Eheheh.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]People can do what they like if it's about this stuff, it's not gonna hurt anyone else![hr][/quote]
Alcohol is responsible for a lot of deaths in the US because of drunk driving, so not quite true.

Still, no reason to avoid it. I love drinking, and if I have the right beer, it even tastes good. Just make sure people around you do it responsibly. And there are plenty of drugs you can use at no great harm to even yourself. Alcohol is much worse then most of them in the long run.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]
